description.text: IOA YANG module which describes a model to describe system capabilities.
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R6.1
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R6.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.1
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R4.0
Re-usable grouping for the configuration-mode attribute.

Means system automaticaly configures the card in slot (or tom in this port), and user cannot
make changes to that.
Means that user can provision or unprovision cards in this slot (or toms in this port).
Configuration mode for the cards in this slot (or toms in this port).
Re-usable grouping.
Capability for each slot. The supported-slots can be within each supported-chassis or supported-card.
Name of the slot.
Physical location of the slot in the chassis

Position of the slot vertically in the chassis, counting
from the top of the chassis/card, in RUs.
Example: position 3 means third RU starting from the top of the chassis/card.

Position of the slot horizontally in the chassis/card within the current RU, counting
from the left of the chassis/card.
For back slots, the position is counted also from the left, from a point of view facing
the rear of the chassis/card.
Whether this slot supports card auto-provisioning.
Card that exists in this slot by default.
Whether this slot requires a BLANK filler card when empty.
Reset power consumption for this card, at 55ÂºC
Describes whether this slot is virtual.
List of possible card types in this slot.
List of LEDs available in the slot.

Top level container for all capability information.
This data is read-only, and expected to be informative to the user
regarding what are the system capabilities.
This information is static and independent on current configuration.
Capabilities can be updated only:
- with SW upgrade
- with a dedicated capabilities file update (for specific cases only)
Top level container for all equipment capabilities.
Golden Application Description Table - provides human readable details for carrier-mode applications.
Table version.
Capability information for supported chassis.
Chassis type name.
Default subtype Supported by chassis.
Human readable description for this chassis-type.
Whether this chassis supports controller redundancy or not.

Whether this chassis supports power control, i.e. the ability to evaluate
the power supply currently provided by the PEMs against the configured equipment.
A chassis that has power control support may put some cards into low power mode
when not enough power is enabled, as well as raising alarms when power protection fail.
Whether FAN(s) rotation are automatically adjusting based on the configured altitude.
Chassis depth in millimeters.
Chassis height in RUs (Rack Units).
Number of equipment holder slots in the front plate on the chassis.
Number of equipment holder slots in the back plate on the chassis.
Supported chassis subtypes; may be empty if chassis doesn't support subtypes.
List of LEDs available in the chassis.

List of chassis-types that this chassis supports as sub-chassis.
If empty, means this chassis-type does not support multi-chassis feature.
Capability information for supported card.
Card type name.
Human readable description for this card-type.

The default card-mode, for cards whose supported-card-mode is not empty.
Only relevant if card has the concept of card-mode.
Not Applicable.
Single slot width.
Double slot width.
Half slot width.
three slot width.
Number of slots this card occupies; not-applicable for RU equipment.
Card height in RUs.
Whether this card-type is a field replaceable unit (FRU).

grid-mode capabilities.
    Only of relevance for line-card(s).
Whether this card-type support location-led operation.
Card-type does not have a serial console port.
Card-type has a serial console port, supporting auto-sensing of baud-rate.
Card-type has a serial console port, supporting manually configured baud-rate.
Whether this card-type supports a serial console port, with or without auto-sensing capabilities.
For cards with fixed baud-rate, defines the default baud-rate.
If true, it means this card-type allows user to configure 3rd Party TOM SerDes values. If false, the card has no need for such customization.
compatibility with any node-type..

Node Type Compatibility refers to supported NE Node-type for a sled card.
    Only of relevance for line-card(s) and carrier-card(s).
Supported card subtypes; may be empty if card doesn't support subtypes.
Supported card-modes; may be empty if card does not support any card-mode.
List of LEDs available in the card.

Supported power profile for this card-type.
Different power profiles can be supported to reflect different scenarios when using this card.
User is able to define, per card instance, which profile is in effect.
This will have impact on the power estimation for the system.
Profile name.
Description of the profile.
Power draw of associated equipment when not in low-power.
Whether is the default value or not.
Capabilities for each port in each supported card.
The port name.
Label on the hardware faceplate.
This port is always present for this card type.

This port is only present if this card is instanciated in a node controller chassis.
Will not be instanciated for sub-chassis cards.

Provides information regarding when is this port present (e.g. instanciated as a managed object).
The majority of ports are statically available for each card type, but some
are only available in specific scenarios, described here.
Tom that exists in this port by default.
Name of the parent port. Only applicable for sub-ports.
List of LEDs available for each port of this card.

List of sub-ports associated with this port.
Only applicable when this port is a parent port.

Capability information for supported TOM (Transceiver Optical Module) in the scope
of this particular card.
TOM type name.
TOM subtype group.
The phy-mode that is used by default in this TOM for this card.
Supported subtypes for this TOM type in this particular card/port.
The phy-mode that are supported in this TOM for this card.

Golden Subtype Constraint Table - contains additional restrictions on supported
carrier modes (defined by gcmt), based on card subtype.
Table version.

Golden Carrier Mode Table - provides list of supported carrier modes in this card.
Applicable for cards that support configurable optical carriers (transponders).
To be used as reference, and in pre-provisioning scenarios.
Once card is physically present, its discovered supported modes will be used instead of these.
Table version.
Golden Advanced Parameters Table - provides a list of known advanced parameters that this card supports.
Table version.
The managed resource type(s) that are applicable for this particular advanced parameter.
Capability information for supported TOM (Transceiver Optical Module).
TOM type name.
The approximate data-rate for this TOM type.
Human readable description for this TOM type.
Whether this TOM type accepts third party TOMs in addition to supported Infinera TOMs.

3rd party subtype for this TOM.
    Available when support 3rd party toms is enable.
Layer 0 Capabilities.
OADM capabilities
Maximum number of degrees.
Maximum number of ADGs (Add/ Drop Group(s))
